source_sentence: 渾渾三界　　浩浩四生　　俱稱火宅　齊號群盲　　昏茲永夜　　長寐未驚　聊裁短付　　燭此幽明　　法藏大願　志存弘誘　　孤標淨剎　　號無量壽　觀開二八　　生歸一九　　影響長弘　千齡不朽淨土論卷下(終)
translation: "All three realms, all four beings, all are called fiery abodes, all are called blind, all are darkened by eternal night, all are unaware, all are short-lived, and all are candled by this obscure light. The great vow of the Dharmâkara, the will to preserve and inspire, the solitary mark of the pure land, the name of Amitâbha, the number of immeasurable lives, the contemplation that opens the 28th heaven, the birth that returns to the 19th heaven, and the influence that spreads over a thousand years, are immortal, and are the second part of the Treatise on the Pure Land (concluded).
